name: Disney Songs I Love Online Trivia | Disney Movies Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where would you hear the song "Little April Showers"?
questions.explanation:
Bambi.

	"Little April Showers" starts like this:"Drip, drip, dropLittle April showerBeating a tuneAs you fall all around" "Bambi" was made in 1942. It is the story of a deer named Bambi who lost his mother at a young age to a hunter. He learns with the help of his friends Thumper (a rabbit) and Flower (a skunk), as well as his father The Prince of the Forest (the head deer in the forest) how to survive.

questions.text: Which characters sang "A Whole New World" in the movie "Aladdin"?
questions.explanation:
Aladdin and Jasmine.

	"I can show you the worldShining, shimmering splendidTell me, princess, now when didYou last let your heart decide!" "Aladdin" is about a poor boy who meets and falls in love with a princess. However, when they "officially" meet, she doesn't realize he was the poor boy in the Market Place because thanks to the Genie he is now a prince. The Genie and his pet monkey Abu do not agree with his tricking the princess to earn her love. She learns about his true self and he learns that it's not what you look like or where you come from that matters. Love can happen between any two people. Now all they need to do with the help of Genie, the Magic Carpet and Abu is defeat the evil sorcerer, Jafar, and his parrot Iago. Aladdin tricks Jafar into becoming a Genie and Jafar and Iago are trapped in a magic lamp. There are two more movies in the "Aladdin" trilogy. The second is called "Return of Jafar" and the third is called "Aladdin and the King of Thieves".

questions.text: In what movie was the song "Bella Notte" sung?
questions.explanation:
Lady and the Tramp.

	"Oh, this is the night, it's a beautiful night And we call it bella notte Look at the skies, they have stars in their eyes On this lovely bella notte" Lady is a cocker spaniel who lives a life of luxury. However, things change once the baby is born and she is virtually ignored. She ends up out in the streets where she meets Tramp, a stray mutt, and they fall in love.

questions.text: "Scales and Arpeggios" is heard in which movie?
options: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
questions.explanation:
The Aristocats.

	"Do mi do mi do so mi doEvery truly cultured music student knowsYou must learn your scales and your arpeggiosBring the music ringing from your chestAnd not your noseWhile you sing your scales and your arpeggios" "The Aristocats" is about three kittens, Marie, Berlioz and Toulouse, and their mother, Duchess. They are the heir to their human's house if she dies. The butler is very angry about this believing he should be the heir so he tries to get rid of the cat and her kittens. While lost and abandoned they meet an alley cat named Thomas O'Malley who introduces them to life in the streets. Duchess falls in love with Thomas but tells him she has to get back home. He helps her get home, where they are caught again by Edgar (the butler). With the help of their friend Roquefort, the mouse, Thomas, and the other alley cats they are rescued once again and this time Edgar is sent from the house (to be shipped to Timbuktu). Their human keeps Thomas and he, Duchess and the the kittens live happily ever after.

questions.text: Who sings "Heigh-Ho" in "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs"?
questions.explanation:
The Dwarfs.

	"We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day throughTo dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to doIt ain't no trick to get rich quickIf you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pickIn a mine! In a mine! In a mine! In a mine!Where a million diamonds shine!" "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs" was Disney's first full-length animated movie. It is about a girl named Snow White whose evil stepmother queen wants to kill her because she is considered fairer than the queen. Snow White ends up living with seven dwarfs named Sleepy, Dopey, Doc, Bashful, Sneezy, Grumpy and Happy. They warn her not to open the door to anyone while they are working. However one day she opens the door to this beautiful lady who's selling apples. The woman gives Snow White an apple and when Snow White bites it she falls down "dead". The woman was actually the evil queen in disguise. The dwarfs find her but cannot bring themselves to bury her quite yet. A prince comes along, sees Snow White and thinking she's the most beautiful thing he's ever seen kisses her. The kiss brings her back to life. She and the prince ride off together and live happily ever after.

questions.text: In which movie do we hear the song "God Help the Outcasts"?
questions.explanation:
The Hunchback of Notre Dame.

	"I don't know if You can hear meOr if You're even thereI don't know if You will listenTo a humble prayerThey tell me I am just an outcastI shouldn't speak to YouStill, I see your face and wonderWere You once an outcast, too?" "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" is about a hunchbacked named Quasimodo. Because he is disfigured, he hides away in a tower where his only friends are gargoyles. He longs to be with other people and eventually meets the gypsy, Esmeralda. He protects her from the evil Frodo who has decided he wants Esmeralda for himself.

questions.text: Who sings "In a World of My Own" in "Alice in Wonderland"?
questions.explanation:
Alice.

	"Alice, pretty little AlicePretty little Alice in WonderlandAlice in wonderlandWon't you take me by the handAnd lead me to your wonderland of loveI took one look at youAnd that was all I had to doAlice, you're the girl I'm dreamin ofTweedle dum, tweedle deeYou have made my life a fantasyYou don't know what you're doin to meMy heart goes pitter patter cause I'm mad as a hatter for Alice my little girl" "Alice in Wonderland" is the story of a girl who falls through a hole while chasing the White Rabbit. This leads to her having all kinds of adventures. One adventure she has is watching a mock turtle race where they run in circles so that nobody ever wins. At the end she meets the Queen of Hearts who wants to behead her (the queen likes to behead people). However, Alice realizes that all the guards are nothing more than a pack of cards. She then wakes up and realizes it was a dream.

questions.text: What movie is "Do You Want to Build a Snowman?" from?
questions.explanation:
Frozen.

	"Do you want to build a snowman?Come on let's go and playI never see you anymoreCome out the doorIt's like you've gone away...We used to be best buddiesAnd now we're notI wish you would tell me why!Do you want to build a snowman?It doesn't have to be a snowman" "Frozen" is the story of two sisters, Elsa and Anna. Elsa has this power where she can create snow and ice. So as children they build a snowman named Olaf. However, Elsa doesn't know how to control her powers which makes her a danger to Anna. Anna doesn't realize this until they are older and they have a ball. Elsa gets upset and starts causing ice to form everywhere she stretches her arm out to. She then runs away and lives in an ice castle she builds for herself. Anna goes out to find her sister and meets Kristoff and Sven (a reindeer). Anna is starting to turn into ice herself, and the only cure is an act of true love. Hans, the man she thought she loved, had tricked her so he could marry her and become heir. He leaves Anna locked in a room to die. Olaf finds her and they manage to escape the building and eventually she runs towards Kristoff. She thinks a kiss from him will save her but it turns out it's saving her sister Elsa that saves her.

questions.text: In which movie do characters sing "Go the Distance"?
questions.explanation:
Hercules.

	"I have often dreamed of a far off placeWhere a hero's welcome would be waiting for meWhere the crowds would cheer, when they see my faceAnd a voice keeps saying this is where I'm meant to be" "Hercules" is a Greek and Roman myth adapted by Disney into a movie. Hercules is the strongest man in the world. He his actually a demi-god (that is half man, half god). With the help of Phil, and Meg (his girlfriend) he learns to control that strength and fights the Hydra Dragon. He then goes down the River Styx to save Meg from Hades, the god of the underworld.

questions.text: Who sings "When You Wish Upon a Star" in "Pinocchio"?
questions.explanation:
Jiminy Cricket.

	"When a star is bornThey possess a gift or twoOne of them is thisThey have the power to make a wish come true" "When You Wish Upon a Star" has become the Disney theme song. "Pinocchio" is the story of a puppet who wants to be a real boy. He has to prove he's worthy to become a real boy and Jiminy Cricket is his conscience. However, he doesn't always listen to Jiminy which gets him in trouble. He keeps telling lies causing his nose to grow bigger and bigger. Eventually, he learns to listen to his conscience and becomes a real boy.
